snippet: Japan has not ruled out stationing government officials on islands at the center of a territorial dispute with China.
abstract: Japan says it is considering stationing government officials on Senkaku islands at center of territorial dispute with China, as fleet of Chinese patrol ships enter disputed waters in East China Sea amid tensions in year-old maritime standoff.

byline.contributor: Hisako Ueno and Makiko Inoue contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Japan has not ruled out stationing government officials on islands at the center of a territorial dispute with China.

headline.main: Japan Is Open to Placing Officials on Disputed Islands
headline.print_headline: Japan Is Open to Placing Officials on Disputed Islands
